title: TC002-user registration process
description: Test the /api/register endpoint to ensure new users can register with valid data and receive appropriate errors for invalid input.
code:
import requests
import uuid

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:80"
TIMEOUT = 30

def test_user_registration_process():
    headers = {
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }

    # Generate unique user data for valid registration
    unique_suffix = str(uuid.uuid4()).replace("-", "")[:8]
    valid_user = {
        "username": f"testuser_{unique_suffix}",
        "email": f"testuser_{unique_suffix}@example.com",
        "password": "ValidPassw0rd!",
        "first_name": "Test",
        "last_name": "User"
    }

    # Testing successful registration
    try:
        response = requests.post(
            f"{BASE_URL}/api/register",
            json=valid_user,
            headers=headers,
            timeout=TIMEOUT
        )
        assert response.status_code == 201, f"Expected 201, got {response.status_code}"
        json_resp = response.json()
        assert isinstance(json_resp, dict), "Response is not a JSON object"
        # Check for at least 'username' or 'id' in the response
        assert 'username' in json_resp or 'id' in json_resp, "Response missing expected keys"

    finally:
        # Clean up: No user deletion API
        pass

    # Testing registration failure cases
    invalid_cases = [
        ({"email": "no_username@example.com", "password": "pass"}, 400),
        ({"username": "user1", "email": "invalid-email", "password": "pass"}, 400),
        ({"username": "user2", "email": "user2@example.com", "password": "123"}, 400),
        ({"username": "user3", "email": "user3@example.com"}, 400),
        ({"username": "", "email": "user4@example.com", "password": "password123"}, 400),
    ]

    for payload, expected_status in invalid_cases:
        try:
            resp = requests.post(
                f"{BASE_URL}/api/register",
                json=payload,
                headers=headers,
                timeout=TIMEOUT
            )
            assert resp.status_code == expected_status, (
                f"Expected {expected_status} for payload {payload}, got {resp.status_code}"
            )
        except requests.RequestException as e:
            assert False, f"RequestException occurred: {e}"

test_user_registration_process()
testError:

title: TC003-user logout operation
description: Test the /api/logout endpoint to confirm that authenticated users can successfully log out and receive confirmation.
code:
import requests
from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:80"
USERNAME = "uniquebishwo@gmail.com"
PASSWORD = "c9PU7XAsAADYk_A"
TIMEOUT = 30

def test_user_logout_operation():
    session = requests.Session()
    try:
        # First, login to get authenticated session (token-based assumed via login returning a token)
        login_url = f"{BASE_URL}/api/login"
        login_payload = {"email": USERNAME, "password": PASSWORD}
        login_headers = {"Content-Type": "application/json"}
        login_response = session.post(login_url, json=login_payload, headers=login_headers, timeout=TIMEOUT)
        assert login_response.status_code == 200, f"Login failed with status code {login_response.status_code}"
        
        # Extract token from login response if present (assuming token-based auth)
        # The instructions say "authType":"basic token", but example only shows login with email/password and session-based auth
        # If token is in JSON response token field named e.g. "token", use it; otherwise, use session cookies.
        login_json = login_response.json()
        token = login_json.get("token")
        headers = {}
        if token:
            headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}
        else:
            # fallback: session cookies are managed by requests.Session automatically
            pass
        
        # Perform logout
        logout_url = f"{BASE_URL}/api/logout"
        logout_response = session.get(logout_url, headers=headers, timeout=TIMEOUT)
        assert logout_response.status_code == 200, f"Logout failed with status code {logout_response.status_code}"
        
        # Confirm logout response content if any expected message or confirmation
        # Since API doc only states 200 with description "Logout successful", loosely validate content
        try:
            resp_json = logout_response.json()
            # If response includes a confirmation field or message we can assert presence of that
            # No explicit schema, so just check it's a dict
            assert isinstance(resp_json, dict)
        except ValueError:
            # Response is not JSON, which is acceptable if no schema defined
            pass
        
        # After logout, accessing a protected endpoint should fail
        profile_url = f"{BASE_URL}/profile"
        profile_response = session.get(profile_url, headers=headers, timeout=TIMEOUT)
        # Expect unauthorized or forbidden (401 or 403 or 401)
        assert profile_response.status_code in (401, 403), "User still authenticated after logout."
        
    except requests.RequestException as e:
        assert False, f"HTTP request failed: {e}"

test_user_logout_operation()
testError:

title: TC004-admin dashboard access control
description: Test the /admin endpoint to verify that only authorized admin users can access the admin dashboard and unauthorized users are denied.
code:
import requests
from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:80"
ADMIN_ENDPOINT = "/admin"
USERNAME = "uniquebishwo@gmail.com"
PASSWORD = "c9PU7XAsAADYk_A"
TIMEOUT = 30


def test_admin_dashboard_access_control():
    # Test authorized access
    try:
        response = requests.get(
            BASE_URL + ADMIN_ENDPOINT,
            auth=HTTPBasicAuth(USERNAME, PASSWORD),
            timeout=TIMEOUT
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200, f"Expected 200 for authorized admin, got {response.status_code}"
        # Optionally, check content if needed (e.g., dashboard presence)
        assert "admin" in response.text.lower(), "Admin dashboard content not found in response."
    except requests.RequestException as e:
        assert False, f"Request to admin endpoint failed for authorized user: {e}"

    # Test unauthorized access - no auth provided
    try:
        response_unauth = requests.get(
            BASE_URL + ADMIN_ENDPOINT,
            timeout=TIMEOUT
        )
        assert response_unauth.status_code == 403 or response_unauth.status_code == 401, \
            f"Expected 403 or 401 for unauthorized user, got {response_unauth.status_code}"
    except requests.RequestException as e:
        assert False, f"Request to admin endpoint failed for unauthorized user: {e}"


test_admin_dashboard_access_control()

title: TC005-admin settings section retrieval
description: Test the /admin/settings/{section} endpoint to ensure correct retrieval of various settings sections, proper handling of invalid sections, and access control.
code:
import requests

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:80"
AUTH_USERNAME = "uniquebishwo@gmail.com"
AUTH_PASSWORD = "c9PU7XAsAADYk_A"
TIMEOUT = 30

def test_admin_settings_section_retrieval():
    auth = (AUTH_USERNAME, AUTH_PASSWORD)
    headers = {
        "Accept": "application/json"
    }

    valid_sections = [
        "general",
        "users",
        "security",
        "email",
        "api",
        "performance",
        "advanced"
    ]
    # Test valid sections
    for section in valid_sections:
        url = f"{BASE_URL}/admin/settings/{section}"
        response = requests.get(url, auth=auth, headers=headers, timeout=TIMEOUT)
        assert response.status_code == 200, f"Expected 200 OK for section '{section}', got {response.status_code}"
        # Optionally verify response content is JSON and contains expected keys if any
        try:
            data = response.json()
            assert isinstance(data, dict), f"Response for section '{section}' is not a JSON object"
        except Exception:
            assert False, f"Response for section '{section}' is not valid JSON"

    # Test invalid section
    invalid_section = "nonexistentsection"
    url_invalid = f"{BASE_URL}/admin/settings/{invalid_section}"
    response_invalid = requests.get(url_invalid, auth=auth, headers=headers, timeout=TIMEOUT)
    assert response_invalid.status_code == 404, f"Expected 404 Not Found for invalid section, got {response_invalid.status_code}"

    # Test access denied with no authentication
    url_any_section = f"{BASE_URL}/admin/settings/general"
    response_no_auth = requests.get(url_any_section, timeout=TIMEOUT)
    # Could be 401 or 403 depending on implementation
    assert response_no_auth.status_code in (401, 403), \
        f"Expected 401 or 403 Unauthorized/Forbidden without auth, got {response_no_auth.status_code}"

test_admin_settings_section_retrieval()

title: TC006-user management listing access
description: Test the /admin/users endpoint to verify that authorized admins can view the user management listing and unauthorized access is prevented.
code:
import requests
from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:80"
AUTH_USERNAME = "uniquebishwo@gmail.com"
AUTH_PASSWORD = "c9PU7XAsAADYk_A"
TIMEOUT = 30

def test_user_management_listing_access():
    url = f"{BASE_URL}/admin/users"
    headers = {
        "Accept": "application/json"
    }
    auth = HTTPBasicAuth(AUTH_USERNAME, AUTH_PASSWORD)

    # Test authorized access
    try:
        response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, auth=auth, timeout=TIMEOUT)
        assert response.status_code == 200, f"Expected 200 for authorized admin, got {response.status_code}"
        json_data = response.json()
        assert isinstance(json_data, (dict, list)), "Expected JSON response to be a dict or list for user listing."
    except requests.RequestException as e:
        assert False, f"Request to authorized admin /admin/users failed: {str(e)}"

    # Test unauthorized access (no auth)
    try:
        response_unauth = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=TIMEOUT)
        assert response_unauth.status_code == 403, f"Expected 403 for unauthorized access, got {response_unauth.status_code}"
    except requests.RequestException as e:
        assert False, f"Request to unauthorized /admin/users failed: {str(e)}"

title: TC010-update user profile information
description: Test the /profile PUT endpoint to verify users can update their profile information with valid data and receive errors for invalid input.
code:
import requests
from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:80"
AUTH = HTTPBasicAuth("uniquebishwo@gmail.com", "c9PU7XAsAADYk_A")
HEADERS = {"Content-Type": "application/json"}
TIMEOUT = 30

def test_update_user_profile_information():
    url = f"{BASE_URL}/profile"

    # Valid update payload
    valid_payload = {
        "first_name": "UpdatedFirstName",
        "last_name": "UpdatedLastName",
        "company": "UpdatedCompany",
        "bio": "This is an updated bio."
    }

    # Invalid update payloads examples (empty strings or wrong data types)
    invalid_payloads = [
        {},  # missing all fields
        {"first_name": ""},  # empty first name
        {"last_name": 123},  # invalid type for last name
        {"company": None},  # null value
        {"bio": 456},  # invalid type for bio
        {"first_name": "A"*300}  # overly long first name (assuming limit)
    ]

    # Test valid update
    try:
        response = requests.put(url, json=valid_payload, headers=HEADERS, auth=AUTH, timeout=TIMEOUT)
    except requests.RequestException as e:
        assert False, f"Request failed for valid payload: {e}"
    else:
        assert response.status_code == 200, f"Expected 200 OK for valid update, got {response.status_code}"
        resp_json = response.json()
        # Assert returned profile fields match updated data if returned
        for key, val in valid_payload.items():
            assert key in resp_json, f"Key {key} missing in response"
            assert resp_json[key] == val, f"Expected {key}='{val}', got '{resp_json[key]}'"

    # Test invalid updates
    for invalid_payload in invalid_payloads:
        try:
            response = requests.put(url, json=invalid_payload, headers=HEADERS, auth=AUTH, timeout=TIMEOUT)
        except requests.RequestException as e:
            assert False, f"Request failed for invalid payload {invalid_payload}: {e}"
        else:
            # Expecting 400 Bad Request or similar error status
            assert response.status_code == 400, (
                f"Expected 400 Bad Request for payload {invalid_payload}, got {response.status_code}"
            )

test_update_user_profile_information()
